def_cn: 基于事实的;真实的;如实的;可信的
def_en: If something is true, it is based on facts rather than being invented or imagined, and is accurate and reliable.

def_cn: (感情)真实的，真挚的；（物品）真的，真正的,正品的
def_en: You use true to emphasize that a person or thing is sincere or genuine, often in contrast to something that is pretended or hidden.

def_cn: 纯粹的;真正的;名副其实的
def_en: If you use true to describe something or someone, you approve of them because they have all the characteristics or qualities that such a person or thing typically has.
If you say that a fact is true of a particular person or situation, you mean that it is valid or relevant for them.
You can use true in order to admit that a fact or opinion is real or valid before indicating that you think that it is not important or relevant in the circumstances.

def_cn: 忠实的;忠诚的;恪守(诺言、思想等)的
def_en: If you are true to someone, you remain committed and loyal to them. If you are true to an idea or promise, you remain committed to it and continue to act according to it.

def_cn: (梦想、愿望或预言)成真，成为现实
def_en: If a dream, wish, or prediction comes true, it actually happens.

def_cn: 同样适用;在…情况下亦然
def_en: If a general statement holds true in particular circumstances, or if your previous statement holds true in different circumstances, it is true or valid in those circumstances.
If you say that something seems too good to be true, you are suspicious of it because it seems better than you had expected, and you think there may something wrong with it that you have not noticed.

def_cn: 栩栩如生;逼真;活灵活现
def_en: If you say that something such as a story or a film is true to life, you approve of it because it seems real.
true colours→see: colour;  true to form→see: form;  to ring true→see: ring;  tried and true→see: tried;
